title: What are some helpful reading materials for someone who wants (and is having trouble) to understand classical music? - Quora

response.answer_text: Since What to Listen for in Music by Aaron Copland is already mentioned, I can only suggest not a reading but a sort of videos made by Daniel Barenboim analysing iconic masterpieces, for instance:

Yes, these are both old, but then this music is timeless. Aaron Copland’s 1957 book What to Listen for in Music I feel I must also mention Leonard Bernstein’s Young People’s concerts, available on YouTube. No, there’s nothing that feels “for children” in them. Maybe start with this episode “What Does Music Mean,” skipping past the introductory footage to 1:28  First the piano-playing prodigy Schroeder in the Peanuts comic strip got me interested, then Bernstein sent me off to the stars.
